p: Second, HCoVs inhibit IFN-I and IFN-III production. The membrane (M) protein of SARS-CoV directly interacts with the innate sensors and the signaling molecules to sequester them in membrane-associated cytoplasmic compartments ( Siu et al., 2009). MERS-CoV M protein inhibits nuclear translocation of IRF3, the transcription factor for IFN genes ( Yang et al., 2013). SARS-CoV nucleocapsid (N) protein also interferes with IRF3 function ( Kopecky-Bromberg et al., 2007). SARS-CoV nsp3 protein, in addition to its papain-like protease (PLP) activity, blocks phosphorylation and nuclear translocation of IRF3 ( Devaraj et al., 2007). This step is further inhibited by the accessory proteins of SARS-CoV, ORF3b and 6, and those of MERS-CoV, ORF 4a, 4b, and 5 ( Lu et al., 2011, Yang et al., 2013). These mechanisms may collectively contribute to the low IFN-I and IFN-III induction in cells infected with SARS-CoV-2 ( Blanco-Melo et al., 2020).
